etymologies: Middle English: from Old French poplier, from Latin populus ‘poplar’

definitions: a tall, fast-growing tree of north temperate regions, widely grown in shelter belts and for timber and pulp.

notes.text: Genus Populus, family Salicaceae: many species, including the North American cottonwoods, the quaking aspen, and the balm of Gilead poplars

shortDefinitions: tall, fast-growing tree of north temperate regions
